benchmark_details.name: A Benchmark for Lease Contract Review
benchmark_details.overview: This paper releases a new benchmark dataset of 179 lease agreement documents annotated with entities and red flags, aimed at improving the automation of contract reviews and reducing risks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark dataset for the automatic detection of entities and red flags in lease agreements.

data.source: Publicly available lease agreements retrieved from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) database.

methods: Random Forest model for red flag detection
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the performance of the models on the annotated dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in MAP, Precision, Recall, and F1 Score indicate better model performance in detecting entities and red flags.
methodology.baseline_results: CRF and Random Forest models established as baselines for comparison.
methodology.validation: Evaluation performed on a split of the annotated dataset.
